All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Add
The `Add` class extends `Command` and implements a method to add a `MusicBand` object to a collection based on user input.
AlbumsValidator
The Albums validator
Builder<T>
Functional generic interface for building Objects of any type.
Clear
The `Clear` class extends `Command` and provides a method to clear the collection managed by `CollectionManager`.
CollectionManager
The `CollectionManager` class in Java represents a singleton manager for a collection of `MusicBand` objects with methods for adding, retrieving, and managing the collection.
Command
The abstract class Command defines properties and methods for a command object in Java.
CommandInterface
Abstract interface that abstract Command class iplements.
CommandManager
The `CommandManager` class in Java manages a collection of commands and executes them based on user input.
Coordinates
Calss Coordinates which serves as a part of MusicBand class
CoordinatesBuilder
Class for building objects of type Coordinates.
CoordinatesValidator
The Coordinates validator.
DateAdapter
The `DateAdapter` class in Java uses synchronized blocks to ensure thread safety when marshalling and unmarshalling Date objects to and from formatted strings.
DumpManager
The `DumpManager` class in Java implements Singleton design pattern and provides methods for saving to and loading from files, converting Date objects to XMLGregorianCalendar, and reading data from a FileInputStream.
EmptyCollectionException
 
ExecuteScript
The `ExecuteScript` class in Java executes a script file while checking for recursion in the script content.
Exit
The `Exit` class in Java extends `Command` and contains a method `execute` that prints a goodbye message and decorative ASCII art before exiting the program if exactly one argument is passed.
GenreValidator
The Genre validator.
GroupCountingById
The `GroupCountingById` class extends a Command class and implements a method to count the number of music bands in a collection with an ID lower than a specified ID.
Help
The Help class extends Command and provides a method to print a list of available commands with their descriptions when executed with exactly one argument.
History
The `History` class in Java represents a command history feature that stores and displays a limited number of previously executed commands.
Info
The Info class extends Command and provides a method to check and print information about a collection.
InputHandler
The `InputHandler` class in Java provides methods for handling user input from the console or a file, including getting different types of input such as integers, longs, and dates.
InvalidCommandException
 
Label
Calss Label which serves as a part of MusicBand class
LabelBuilder
Class for building objects of type Label.
LabelValidator
The Label validator.
Main
The main class of the application that starts the program
MinByNumberOfParticipants
This Java class extends Command and implements a function to find and print the music band with the lowest number of participants in a collection.
MusicBand
Main class representing a MusicBand type with fields like id, name, genre etc.
MusicBandBuilder
The type Music band builder.
MusicBandRequester
The Music band requester class is used to perform operations with requesting Music Bands from user and non-user requesters.
MusicBandValidator
The Music band validator.
MusicGenre
The enum Music genre which serves as a part of MusicBand class.
NameValidator
The Name validator.
RemoveById
The `RemoveById` class extends a command class and implements a method to remove a music band from a collection by ID.
RemoveLower
The `RemoveLower` class in Java defines a command that removes a `MusicBand` object from a collection based on a specified ID while handling exceptions and avoiding `ConcurrentModificationException`.
Save
This Java class represents a "Save" command that takes an array of strings, checks for one element, and marshals a CollectionManager object into an XML file using JAXB.
Show
The `Show` class extends `Command` and implements a function to sort and print elements of a collection managed by a `CollectionManager` instance.
UpdateId
This Java class defines a command to update the ID of a music band in a collection if the ID is unique.
Validator<T>
The generic functional abstract interface Validator.
